intro: Ptilotus sericostachyus, commonly known as the silky ptilotus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its soft, silky hairs covering its stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red, often appearing in late summer to autumn. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Ptilotus sericostachyus is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
